snippet: Sales tax revenues from seven California cities and counties that have banned smoking in bars suggest that the practice is not bad for business, according to a study in The American Journal of Public Health.    The tobacco industry strongly oppose...
lead_paragraph: Sales tax revenues from seven California cities and counties that have banned smoking in bars suggest that the practice is not bad for business, according to a study in The American Journal of Public Health. The tobacco industry strongly opposes bans on smoking in restaurants and bars, saying they keep customers away.
abstract: Study by University of California researcher finds sales tax revenues from seven California cities and counties that have banned smoking in bars suggests practice is not bad for business (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Study Sees No Link In Smoking and Bar Sales
